name: o-iodobenzonitrile
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base, with a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius, due to the presence of two phenyl groups, which can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the iodine atom can participate in hydrogen bonding, which can raise the melting point by approximately +10°C.
